title: Early Education Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: There was a Zoom interview and the interviewer was very nice and I enjoyed talking to her. I felt the company was warm and welcoming. The interview was set up through email, which I found convenient.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview was quite casual and laidback. They ask you generic questions about your experience working with children and what you would do in situations of conflict. It isn’t that stressful as long as you know what you’re saying.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a kid was unmotivated and not participating in activities?

title: Youth Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA (Pearland, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process. With complex STAR type questions. Really want to get to know the type of person you are. Two different interviews and decides what position you best suit.
Interview Questions: Situational question: how would you handle _____?

title: Janitor/Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with panel of individuals and background of prior work experiences. Personality questions as well. Was very friendly and welcoming. Asked a lot about family and motivation to getting back into the work force.
Interview Questions: Name one thing you love

title: Daycare Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: They barely asked me anything before hiring me. They also told me to bring my bank information to the interview to set up direct deposit BEFORE they even interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Working for the YMCA was great. It was a positive work place, great supports, and very understanding supervisors. Summer camp and after school programs were run very well and structured.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself (any hobbies or future career goals)

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: I Met with regional manager. Met in person. Very kind and good questions. Filled out paper application afterwards. Finger printing done after hire. Background and reference check competed as well.
Interview Questions: What is your management style

title: Director of Wellness Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Smooth very nice people straight forward They clearly cared about the community they are working with You could tell they are looking for someone to be a part of their team and that could fit in well
Interview Questions: How I wanted to impact the area My experience in different areas My experience in non-for profits Could I make the commute If I worked well with different age groups What age groups I worked with the most

title: Weekend Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Easy and fluid, they were respectful of my time and the manager was great. I was offered the job and accepted. Worked with my hours in college. I would recommend.
Interview Questions: Will I learn to drive the zamboni

title: Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: meet with talent individual and then hiring manager. Final interview with VP who then invited me in to meet the team which was a nice experience. Waited 3 weeks for the results
Interview Questions: Tell me why you want this job

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: First you will have a zoom interview; then once you accepted then you go in person to see the work environment for 30 min then they will tell you what are the next steps
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ? Why you want to work at the y ?

title: Director Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at YMCA (Augusta, GA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Resume is reviewed along with extraneous experience. Company is transparent about pay and gas compensation. You will be interviewed by an official director in the position and be given multiple options for other job opportunities in the program that you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer mornings or afternoons (mornings have less hour requirements)?

title: Childcare Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great and very friendly. Would recommend. Easy and relatable questions. Open to negotiations. Flexible. Good responses. Group interview with one other person. Felt comfortable. Fit in with job description. With 2 managers . Ease of communication.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA (Ambler, PA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: there was 1 jnterview and it was not that difficult but i had to be very prepared to answer all the questions. i answered smart but it was very fun
Interview Questions: there was no questions to ask

title: Gym Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone conversation then an in person interview. The screening call is more informative more than anything. They want to know what kind of experience you have in the Recreation field.
Interview Questions: Have you ever coached a sports team? How do you handle disorderly kids?

title: Child Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at YMCA in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Group interview , it was thru zoom they messages us personally for personal questions and moral work, overall pretty easy they ask the basics then got into how to handle a classroom and finally into moral wyation what ifs etc, finally they ask for availability locations and benefits
Interview Questions: Asking about situations like if a child where to fall what would you do

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process is pretty simple and quick. Asked about your goals and how your management with people. The interview was with two people and I believe the do a background and definitely a drug test.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult customer?

title: SACC TEACHER Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: phone or zoom screening (forgot which one i had) then 2 in persons. was easy and and interviewers were great with conversations outside of just the interview. make sure you talk about working with kids!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: SAC Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: It was not too bad First A brief Phone interview then in person interview with two managers asking questions off a sheet alternating questions. It was fairly comfortable and laid back in the questioning
Interview Questions: Availability Diversity Handle tough situations

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was actually very easy, mostly conversation based. Just basic questions about prior experience and why you want to work here. Would definitely recommend it to someone else.
Interview Questions: What is your prior experience?

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Super simple questions. Dress nice, no sandals or such. Be super kind, genuine & of course honest. I received an offer about an hour after my interview. The people are super kind & welcoming
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength

title: After School Youth Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA (San Bernardino, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Super easy over the phone screening. They just ask you about your experience and tell you about the job. They ask you if you have a school preference and if you don’t have college credit you take a test.
Interview Questions: Do you have prior experience working with kids?

title: Dance Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: I had a conversation with what would eventually be my manager over the phone. I then had an interview in person. After the conversation, we went down to the studio while a class was going on and they had me go through basics steps with the kids.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with (various age groups).

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Easy. They are mainly looking to assess your judgement skills and ability to analyze a situation and make proper choices. They are looking for you to be responsible. Overall very easy.
Interview Questions: How would you handle this?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short. It mostly consisted of what my job history was like and how it applies to lifeguarding. I liked working at the YMCA as a summer lifeguard and would consider it a valuable experience.
Interview Questions: What is a strength of yours?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very easy, only a few basic questions about what I wanted out of the job. Along with any experience I had with children and with summer camp. It only took a couple days to receive an interview offer.
Interview Questions: How would I manage a bad behavior?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was super nice and easy to talk to.  It was a quick easy process. They contacted me pretty quickly after I applied. The pay is low but you get a free gym membership so that’s pretty cool.
Interview Questions: Asked me to complete a drug screen

title: Consoler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was a relative easy interview. You may be expected the head may ask you questions in terms of kids. What are you going to do if you have a bad mood. What makes you a special person.
Interview Questions: What makes you a special person.

title: After School Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really simple and I didn't think the questions were hard. My interview had a lot of leadership and team-leading questions. These basic questions are meant to draw out those with leadership experience. It was a group interview and everyone had the opportunity to answer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a parent came to pick up a child and the child wasn't there?

title: Swim Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA (Cedar Park, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Overall the process was easy and smooth. The Director at the time asked a few questions and then offered me the job at the end of the interview. Once hired, you do have to go through some classes and fill out a lot of paperwork but all to be expected!
Interview Questions: What is your experience level as a swimmer?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The position is is heavily wanted because it is very popular position. This position is amazing and I love it. The interview was really good and the questions were easy and forward.
Interview Questions: Why do you believe you are a good fit for this position?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Easy and laid back. I felt comfortable. The interview was also short. The questions that were asked made me think outside of the box.  Also, the interview was not too lengthy
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with youth ?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was short, maybe 15 minutes. The questions were easy and straight forward. Overall, my experience with the interview with ymca was great. The process was pretty fast.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience

title: Lifegurd & Swim Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Short with specific questions of certifications and working with children. Interviewed with only one person at the location. Very relaxed setting that felt supportive and understanding. Also specifically asked about how long I wanted to stay in the role.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with children of different ages?

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: they have three steps of interviews for the first they called me and had a brief conversation on the phone the second time had a video conference meeting the last step is another technical interview
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that make you a good web developer?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Apply on the website and then receive an email to interview. Following the interview got the offer for the job. The interview took place with the person that ended up being my supervisor.
Interview Questions: Experience with kids; SEL; difficult experience with kid.

title: Gym Monitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: First you interview with the hiring manager.  If they like you they bring you to the coordinator's office.  It is pretty simple and doesn't take too long.  I would say it took me about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions:
Q. What is your educational background

Q. What sports are you good at running? 

Q. How do you deal with conflict?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Had a walk and talk Interview with the CEO.  We toured the building and talked about different things as we walked around the facility.

Then we had a formal interview for about 15 minutes in his office  before giving a Marketing Presentation to the entire leadership team.  

Total time was about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: What would you do differently in our Marketing Strategy?

title: Childcare Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was organized and asked a short series of expected interview questions. Not surprising or stressful. I talked for about 15 minutes and the rest of the time was used to give me more information about the job and my responsibilities. The job was offered to me at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that you feel would help you in this role?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and very welcoming. They sit you down with two managers and HR to ask you questions about experience and history. All the management and front desk people portrayed a positive environment.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you have dealt with criticism and how you reacted.

title: Learn and Play Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: It was a one-on-one meeting with the supervisor. She mostly asked me questions relating to my resume. She wanted to know how long I had worked with children and how competent I was. It was a casual and comfortable process -- very lighthearted and friendly.
Interview Questions: They asked me how long I had been working with kids. They also asked me how I would handle a situation where two babies wanted the same toy.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: So great for a first job at 16! Highly recommend to anyone looking to foster a great first work experience. Great full-circle experience from start to finish -- a wonderful learning opportunity.
Interview Questions: How do you stay positive when things get tough

title: Executive Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and very nice. It was personal but relaxing. Was very fast. No questions stood out. It was a very original question. Was a nice place to work out but long hours.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: You are with a group of the ymca team and asked how you will handle situations with guests who is not happy with them missing their regularly planned meeting that was canceled.
Interview Questions: How you handle angry clients

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview.  No written test. Questions based on previous employment experience. Asked about reasons for leaving. 3-minute self-introduction, your strength and weakness.  What is your goal and expectation. Interview not difficult.
Interview Questions: Questions based on your past experience.

title: ydp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Phone call and a question are that they send to your email and then meet other people in person and idk I’m just trying to fill the word count on this thing rn it’s annoying
Interview Questions: What’s your availability for this

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Super friendly with a series of questions about where I was from and my previous work experience. I took the opportunity to ask about the youth program that I would be supporting.
Interview Questions: About myself and my background

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at YMCA
Interview Descriptions: Easy online interview with a few people asking questions and taking notes. They guide you through the process and make you feel very comfortable during the whole thing. After they will email you with a decision.
Interview Questions: About your leadership and other work experiences.

title: Recruitment Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at YMCA (Sydney) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and Progressive with a good positive experience aligned with the role. Interview length was also nice and then made me understood about the company structure and how the role works briefly.
Interview Questions: Past Experience based Questions and few behavioural questions.

title: Early Childhood Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at YMCA (Mississauga, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very long about forty-five minutes, alot of questions with many steps. It was my first experience with interviews . In person interview. I think that I was need more preparation for this interview to pass it successfully.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your self?

title: Childcare Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at YMCA (State College, PA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Asked about education and experience and how you would teach. Also asked about keystones stars and if I’m familiar with it. It was pretty easy and relaxed. I was also asked to describe what you’d see if someone walked into the classroom.
Interview Questions: How many years experience do you have?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at YMCA in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy zoom interview. I was in the room with two of the camp leaders, I answered a few questions about my background and values, and I got the job offer at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with children as regards to discipline?

title: Lifegurad Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at YMCA (Fort Thomas, KY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was either by phone or in person. didn't take long to hear from the staff. All proper certifications were needed or classes were set up in order to have the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have the needed certification to be a lifeguard?

title: Head Swim Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA (Ocala, FL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It is generally easy. Show your proof that you deserve the job. Show experience and that is basically it. Employees and lifeguard are really kind to you about everything and are willing to help you
Interview Questions: What makes a leader in any situation

title: Summer Camp Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a generic process for a summer role. Met with DOO and Executive Director of Branch. I went through 3 rounds of interviews with final round being onsite at the camp facility with a tour.
Interview Questions: Describe your experiences working with kids and why your past roles would make you a good fit for this position.

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at YMCA (Richmond, VA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: an in-person short interview had a short conversation with the manager and told her more of who I am my availability and why I wanted to work there. Got offered job after interview
Interview Questions: are you good working with kids

title: Member Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA (Port Angeles, WA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and painless. I did an over-the-phone screening with my would-be supervisor and then was asked to come in for an in-person interview. The interview lasted about 15 to 20 minutes and I was asked pretty basic questions about my prior work history, have I ever encountered a difficult situation in my previous workplace and how did I solve that issue,  why I left my previous job, and what my goals were in terms of how long I would be planning on staying at the YMCA if I were to be hired. I dressed in business casual and came with my resume printed out just in case.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation at work or in your personal life that was difficult and how did you go about solving it?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YMCA (Richmond, VA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy group interview that involved group games  to understand team work and personality.  We did a form of game that would be played with students to also understand how willing you are to put yourself out there, There was also a hand written portion to get to know you personally.
Interview Questions: Describe a problem you've delt with and how you solved it

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA (Markham, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Fairly short and straightforward, they care more about your availability than anything else. It's a quick one-on-one with the volunteer manager after you apply. Mine lasted around 15 minutes, and I was asked around 5 questions.
Interview Questions:
What are the 5 core values of the YMCA?
Why do you want to work with children?
Why do you want to volunteer at YMCA?

title: Site Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: great! very easy and straightforward. I had to prepare a lot of paperwork to show that I was qualified to help students with homework but I liked that. Would recommend as an entry job to younger people.
Interview Questions: What special skills or talents do you have?

title: Site Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: great! very easy and straightforward. I had to prepare a lot of paperwork to show that I was qualified to help students with homework but I liked that. Would recommend as an entry job to younger people.
Interview Questions: What special skills or talents do you have?

title: Assistant Group Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at YMCA in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: A pretty simple 30 minute interview. Questions were basic and primarily about how you would resolve a behavioral issue with children and what makes you want to work with them.
Interview Questions: If you could decorate a tee shirt to tell parents and kids about you, how would you decorate it?

title: Gymnastics Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with the gymnastics supervisor who asked questions in a traditional interview fashion and gave me paperwork to complete after. Knew supervisor previously and the interview was very casual.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weaknesses

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at YMCA (Newcastle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasts like 10min at most and is super easy to get a job. You apply online and get a call same day to schedule an interview. Then you come in and get asked some questions. If they like you then they have you fill out some information, get a background check, do a drug test, and finalize your direct deposit. You start almost immediately.
Interview Questions: Super easy. You get asked questions like “if you could be any toy what would you be?”, “if you could be a color to describe your emotion what would you choose?, etc…

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at YMCA (Wyckoff, NJ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, easy, and enjoyable. Chatted for ~25 minutes about the position and why I was fit for the position. 1 interview in person in busy room then was offered.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience with kids and how do you act in certain situations of misbehavior from children?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and informal. You shouldn’t worry about any curve ball questions. Just be respectful and honest and you’ll likely get the job. They will train you and pay you while you train if you get the job before you get your certification.
Interview Questions: Do you have any certifications

title: Gymnastics Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at YMCA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was alright but it was fast hiring process took MONTHS. i was hired november and wasn’t able to come in until february. so yeah it sucked. I just wanna see glassdoor
Interview Questions: what is your experience with teaching to little kids

title: Member Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: LONG. There were interview questions, tour of the facility, then I had to talk to guest, and then give the interviewer a tour of the facility. A lot of work for a minimum wage job.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you?

title: After School Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA (Long Beach, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: First, I had a phone interview and edit through that then was asked to create a short and educational lesson for a class of third grade students . After the lesson I had an in person interview and was explained in depth what my position entailed.
Interview Questions: If I had experience working with children

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
they want to get to know you

they want to make sure you are a responsible person

it is important to make sure you'll keep people safe in the swimming pool when you are watching them

are you willing to clean the pool deck and be productive while you are not on the stand?
Interview Questions:
are you willing to work hard

how well do you pay attention

title: Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA (Saint Paul, MN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with situational questions about how you would best handle kids in different situations, like what would you do if a kid was being excluded from other kids that did not want to play with them.
Interview Questions: what would you do if a kid was being excluded from other kids that did not want to play with them.

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at YMCA (Tacoma, WA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Process was quick and simple. I submitted an application online and was contacted by the manager to schedule an interview.  The interview took 30 minutes and I heard back within one week.
Interview Questions: What are the YMCA Core Values?

title: Science Summer Camp Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: group interview with time to ask for personal questions. Its just to get a better feel of what type of person you are and if you are excited to work there.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child's parent came to you yelling because their child seems to have gotten sunburnt ?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at YMCA (Birmingham, AL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really short and  I received an answer quickly. Initially there was phone call interview was made which was really quick. And then the Camp Director called the lists of references.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience with children?
How do you stay organized?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Site Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at YMCA (South Lowell, MA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back. It was held at the ymca right in the middle of the gym and pool. The woman who interviewed me was interrupted several times and that Became frustrating
Interview Questions: Have you ever been charged with a felony
